ext_descriptions.ext_description: A land_template_terminal_class lists the classes of the land template terminal. The class description is in the context of a limited geometric domain stratum virtualization defined by the extent of the related land template. The description assumes that there is a vertical cutting plane through the stratum in the neighborhood of the terminal.
specifies that the terminal is a point on the horizontal surface of a stratum near the cutting plane;
specifies that the terminal is an edge curve on the surface of a stratum and is in the domain of the cutting plane and of the stratum horizontal surface;
specifies that the terminal is a point on the edge of a stratum and is in the domain of the cutting plane and of the stratum horizontal surface;
specifies that the terminal is an area on the surface of a stratum in the neighborhood of the cutting plane but need not intersect the domain of the cutting plane;
A layer_position_type lists the types of the layer position in the sequence of layers.
specifies that the layer position is secondary, a design layer opposite that of the primary layer;
specifies that a layer may be in any sequential position;
specifies that layer position is either the primary or secondary layer;
specifies that layer position is the z-axis zero position in the vertical sequence of layers;
specifies that layer position is not one of primary or secondary;
A predefined_design_layer_purpose lists the purposes of the layer, in the context of the types of signals intended to be implemented.
specifies that layer is used for a signal other than power or ground;
specifies that layer is used for lands only;
specifies that layer is used for power or ground signals;
specifies that layer is used for an embedded passive capacitor dielectric;
specifies that layer is used for an embedded passive resistor conductor;
A predefined_documentation_layer_purpose lists the predefined purpose of the documentation layer.
specifies that documentation layer is soldermask;

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is solderpaste;
ext_description.note: In the context of this part of ISO 10303, specifies that solder paste applied during an assembly manufacturing process is deposited only where there are positive regions in the model.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is silkscreen;
ext_description.note: An application of silkscreen requires a rigid surface but this part of ISO 10303 does not enforce that level of process modeling.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is generic layer;
ext_description.note: A generic_layer does not have a predefined purpose.
ext_description.example: The generic dielectric known to exist between design layers is assigned a purpose of generic_layer.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is glue;
specifies that documentation layer is gluemask;
ext_description.note: The gluemask layer is usually a negative image and requires correct interpretation by post-processors for mass property calculations of the PCA or PWA.

ext_description.p: specifies that documentation layer is pastemask;
ext_description.note: The pastemask layer is usually a negative image and requires correct interpretation by post-processors for mass property calculations of the PCA or PWA.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies that documentation layer is finish coating.

A stiffness_class lists the predined types of stiffness.
These predefined types apply to properties of materials used in PCB/PWB and PWA/PWB domain. They are primarily used to distinguish between stages of materials that exist during the fabrication and assembly manufacturing processes and not the stages of material as delivered to a customer as part of an assembly or interconnect.
specifies that the type is B-stage or equivalent in rigidity and fluid flow with constant thickness properties under manufacturing conditions;
specifies that the type is B-stage or equivalent in rigidity and fluid flow with varying thickness properties under manufacturing conditions;
specifies that the type is C-stage laminate or equivalent in rigidity;
The ft_terminus_condition lists the terminus conditions.

ext_description.p: specifies that each end of the passage contacts the stratum identified as being the end of the passage but does not penetrate the stratum;
ext_description.note: In typical industrial usage bilateral_bond forms a plug instead of a passage because both ends of the passage are closed. A plug may be formed when micro-vias are stacked in the same exact location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: that each end of the passage passes completely through the stratum identified as being the end of the passage;

ext_description.p: specifies that one end of the passage contacts the stratum identified as being that end of the passage and the other end of the passage passes completely through the stratum identified as being that end of the passage.
ext_description.example: A micro-via is an example application of a unilateral_bond.
ext_description.note: Bond in this context specifies sufficient bonding to support desired reliability of the bond formed during manufacture.

The purpose of bond in this context is to support additive technologies which partially or completely fill the passage and which bond to the target feature in the stratum that is specified as a contact stratum. The target feature in the contact stratum is not explicitly identified as a target feature to reduce model size.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The up_or_down lists the dependencies between
members.

indicates that there is no dependency between
members;

indicates that the subsequent
is based on the precedent .

indicates that the precedent
is based on the subsequent .
A Blind_passage_template is a type of . The Blind_passage_template includes sufficient data to determine feature properties for passages that do not penetrate the complete substrate.

specifies a role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies a role of the
for the Blind_passage_template.

specifies normal or reversed as the
for the Blind_passage_template. Normal specifies that the orientation is parallel to the normal of the reference surface. Reversed specifies that the orientation is anti-parallel to the normal of the reference surface.
A datum_reference shall not be a .

ext_description.p:
A Component_termination_passage_template is a type of
and a type of . The Component_termination_passage_template defines all shape data for the associated
(for which it is the
), and also where the connection (dependency) on passage technology is established for the properties.
ext_description.note: Properties other than shape are to be found in the of_passage_technology.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Component_termination_passage_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Component_termination_passage_template as its . There shall be two or more Component_termination_passage_template_terminals for the Component_termination_passage_template.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared to be for the Component_termination_passage_template.
A Component_termination_passage_template_interface_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides an interface capability to the next level of assembly.
A Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which provides a fabrication join capability, within an optionally constrained set of .

specifies the
for which a connection to the Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal is disallowed. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There may be more than one
for the Component_termination_passage_template_join_terminal.

A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is a type of . A Component_termination_passage_template_terminal is one of a
or a .

specifies the for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal. There shall be one or more Connection_zone_in_layout_templates for each connection_area. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied.

specifies a role of the
for the Component_termination_passage_template_terminal.

The combination of associated_definition and
inherited from
shall be unique within a population of Component_termination_passage_template_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p: A Continuous_template is a type of . All the points that make up the domain of the Continuous_template shall be connected, that is any point in the domain of the Continuous_template shall be reachable starting at any other point in the domain.
ext_description.note: Supported representations of Continuous_template are standard implementations of common industrial practice of filled figure and path figure.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
All
of Continuous_template shall be of type .

A Copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of , stating that the geometry of the relating
is copied to the geometry of the related . In the case that a
is referenced by several Copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as related, the resulting geometry is the union of the geometries of all the relating Stratum_technology_occurrences.

A Counterbore_passage_template is a type of . A Counterbore_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages. The first passage is either a through-hole or a blind hole, and the orientation of the second passage (the counterbore) is the same as that of the first passage. The first passage is smaller than the second passage, which has a blind bottom condition that mates with the top of the first passage.

specifies a role of the
for the Counterbore_passage_template. The larger_passage specifies the data that is associated with the larger opening of the Counterbore.

specifies a role of the
for the Counterbore_passage_template. The smaller_passage specifies the data that is associated with the smaller opening of the Counterbore.

A Countersunk_passage_template is a type of . A Countersunk_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages, one cylindrical and one tapered. The initial diameter of the tapered passage will be larger than the diameter of the cylindrical passage, and will linearly taper to be the same diameter as the cylindrical passage where the two passages meet.

specifies a role of the
for the Countersunk_passage_template. The tapered_passage specifies the data that is associated with the tapered area of the Countersunk passage.

specifies a role of the
for the Countersunk_passage_template. The constant_diameter_passage specifies the data that is associated with the constant diameter opening of the Countersunk passage.

A Single_stratum_continuous_template is a type of
and a type of . A Single_stratum_continuous_template is either a
or a .
A Single_stratum_template is a type of . A Single_stratum_template is a .
A Stratum_feature_template is a type of that is a definition or partial definition of a . A Stratum_feature_template is a . A Stratum_feature_template defines a contiguous material shape.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_stack_model is a type of that is included to define the sequence of materials in an interconnect. The stackup model is a representation of a graph and the represented graph has specific properties. The graph is a directed graph. The graph is acyclic with the sole exception being a single loop configuration for the situation where there is exactly one
in the model. Because the graph relates to material structures which are connected, the graph is a connected graph. The graph may have multiple roots and multiple paths from a root to a leaf element. The convention in this part of ISO 10303 is that the direction of the elements of the graph is in the negative z dimension. The stackup is devoid of any pattern information and is intended to serve as a foundational structure.
ext_description.example: Figure 4 in ISO/TS 10303-1737 illustrates several simple stackups for microstrip design structures. The parametric information related to the vertical extents of the elements in the illustration would be derived from the properties of the nodes of the stackup model which are . The properties of the are inherited from the in the role of definition for the . The parametric information related to the horizontal extents of the elements in the illustration is unrelated to the Stratum_stack_model.
A design stackup that includes different final finish materials in different regions on the top side will have multiple root elements and therefore multiple paths through the graph.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_stack_model. There shall exist one or more Stratum_technology_occurrences for the Stratum_stack_model.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_stack_model is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_stack_model as its . There shall exist one or more Stratum_technology_occurrence_relationships for the Stratum_stack_model.

ext_description.p:
A Material_removal_feature_template is a type of
that describes the shape of material to be removed from a feature. A Material_removal_feature_template shall not have voids either when represented by an explicit geometric model or when a parametric representation by a path figure is resolved in a receiving system.

example.p: Figure 5 illustrates a template and associated parameters designed for electrical isolation. For a specific template, values will be assigned for the parameters and the explicit geometry will be representative of the assigned parameter values. The illustration includes two templates to support the parameter illustration. The outer template is the Material_removal_feature_template.

Figure 6 illustrates a structure designed for thermal isolation. For this figure, multiple Material_removal_feature_template help compose a structure to achieve the desired configuration. The figure illustrates the end result of the composition process.

figure.title: Material_removal_feature_template participates in structure to support thermal isolation

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.
There shall be at least one shape.
There shall be no voids in the model that represents Material_removal_feature_template.
A Passage_deposition_material_identification is a type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Passage_deposition_material_identification. There shall exist one or more Passage_technologies for the Passage_deposition_material_identification.
A Passage_filling_material_identification is a type of .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Passage_filling_material_identification. There shall exist one or more Passage_technologies for the Passage_filling_material_identification.

An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a type of . An Inter_stratum_feature_template may be one of a , an , or a . An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a definitional construct that defines the cross-section shape of layered constructs.

specifies a role of the
for the Inter_stratum_feature_template. The of_passage_technology specifies the material and layered properties for the Inter_stratum_feature_template.

The
shall not be populated.

An Inverse_copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of , stating that the geometry of the related
is an inverse copy of the geometry of the relating . In the case that a
is referenced by several Inverse_copy_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as related, the resulting geometry is the intersection of the geometries of all the relating Stratum_technology_occurrences.

A Design_layer_technology is a type of . The Design_layer_technology is a technology specification tailored for those materials intended to be used to implement the direct connectivity as described in a design. The same Design_layer_technology may be used in multiple designs for multiple products, since there is no dependence of the Design_layer_technology on the design referencing it. A Design_layer_technology shall not be used for printed components as defined by where conductivity class other than 'conductive' is required because the conductivity class of a Design_layer_technology is required to be 'conductive'.
An example where an application of Design_layer_technology is inappropriate is for paste resistors on a layer where the paste resistors are not also interconnected on that same layer since the conductivity class for a paste resistor is 'resistive'. The terminals of the paste resistors in this example would be bonded to features of a design layer during fabrication in order to realize interconnect between each other. A via may be dropped onto a paste resistor if the realization process supports it.
An example where an application of Design_layer_technology is required is for printed coils where the coil is fabricated from the same physical layer as the rest of the wiring that implements the interconnect.
specifies the of the smallest permissible distance between features for the Design_layer_technology.
specifies the of the smallest permissible extent of a feature for the Design_layer_technology.

specifies the
for the Design_layer_technology. The design_layer_purpose specifies one of the lands_only, other_signal, or power_or_ground purpose of the for the Design_layer_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Design_layer_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Design_layer_technology as its . There shall be no more than one
for the Design_layer_technology.
The inherited from shall be at least one of: thermally, electrically, optically or magnetically conductive.

ext_description.p: The design_layer_purpose or externally_defined_design_layer_purpose shall exist but not both together.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Documentation_layer_technology is a type of that may have patterns applied and whose purpose is not for directly implementing point to point connectivity as in the . A Documentation_layer_technology shall be used for printed components as defined by
where conductivity class other than 'conductive' is required because the conductivity class of a Documentation_layer_technology may be something other than 'conductive'. The externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose provides a facility to specify the detailed nature of the application. A standard external to this part of ISO 10303 or industrial exchange agreements may formalize the externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose.
An example where an application of Documentation_layer_technology is appropriate is for paste resistors with a conductivity class of 'resistive'.
An example where an application of Documentation_layer_technology is appropriate is for paste capacitors with a conductivity class of 'non conductive'.

specifies the
to describe the purpose defined in this part of ISO 10303 for the Documentation_layer_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Documentation_layer_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Documentation_layer_technology as its . There shall be no more than one
for the Documentation_layer_technology.

ext_description.p: The pre_defined_documentation_layer_purpose or externally_defined_documentation_layer_purpose shall exist but not both together.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Filled_unsupported_passage_template is a type of .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Filled_unsupported_passage_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Filled_unsupported_passage_template as its . There shall be exactly one
for a Filled_unsupported_passage_template.
The fill_material shall have a conductivity classification.

A Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template is a type of
and a type of . This template shape is dependent only on the shape of the it is intended to mate with.

specifies a role of the
for the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template.
the name of the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template. It shall be ' '.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template as its . There shall be one or more for a Default_attachment_size_based_land_physical_template. Fabrication and assembly tolerances define the required shapes and variances for the terminal shapes.
If there is one or more connection area the name 'minimum attachment region size' shall be included in the set of strings.
If there are two or more connection areas one of the names shall be one of 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area'.
If there are three or more connection areas two of the names shall be include 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area' but the name shall not be repeated.
If there are four connection areas each of the names 'maximum attachment region size','heel area', 'toe area' shall be used but the names shall not be repeated.

The
shall not be populated.
There shall be exactly one member of interface_access_mechanisms.
The Shape_element.id shall be equal to the Item_shape.id.

that defines a default passage based on characteristics of the associated .

specifies a role of the
for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

specifies a role of the
for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

for the Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

that specifies the Default_component_termination_passage_definition as its . There shall be exactly one
for a particular Default_component_termination_passage_definition.

ext_description.p: the deposition_material shall be of type .

The supertype
specifies that the deposition material shall be conductive. An application interface shall specify the domain, usually electrical.

ext_description.note: The usual domain technical reference is ANSI/IPC D-275.

A Default_via_definition is a type of
that defines the default shape of the . Mandatory properties are identified.

ext_description.p:
A Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is a type of
for the purpose of stating that the geometry of the related
is derived from the relating view. A
that is based/mapped to a
that is referenced by a Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as related shall not have any explicit . A Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship is either a
or an . A
shall not be referenced by several Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship as related of mixed types (we can't have a mix of copy and copy-inverse).
The graph established by Derived_stratum_technology_occurrence_relationship shall be acyclic.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Default_land_physical_template is a type of . A Default_land_physical_template is either a or a .

an attribute inherited from the specifies the role of the for the Default_land_physical_template. There may be more than one for a Default_land_physical_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Land_physical_template is a type of . A Land_physical_template may be a or a . If the material the Land_physical_template is composed of it conductive, the Land_physical_template provides the functionality of a short among its terminals. Each member of Land_physical_template that is assigned a classification shall be assigned a unique classification.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates explicit geometry that represents simplified Land_physical_template.

ext_description.p:
an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Land_physical_template as its . The pre_defined_classification_code need not be specified for a specific Land_physical_template.
ext_description.note:
IEC 61182-1 provides a set of
identifiers. See figure 2.

The Land_physical_template, , and the Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing capabilities of this part of ISO 10303 may be used to unambiguously exchange the shape of both pre-defined
patterns that include only geometry (as from IEC 61182-1) and enterprise defined patterns. When this facility is used to create more than one equivalent
definition, it may not be possible to maintain knowledge of the connection functionality of the
definition. This is because
is an atomic concept in this part of ISO 10303.

The , , and the Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing capabilities of this part of ISO 10303 may be used to unambiguously exchange both the shape and connection knowledge of
patterns that include pre-defined geometry (as from IEC 61182-1) and enterprise defined geometry that have explicit definitions of the fabrication and assembly constraints.
The Land_physical_template inherit material property data from .
ext_description.p:
When there is a member of pre_defined_classification_code provided, the
attribute of the member shall be the same for all members of Land_physical_template. When there is a member of pre_defined_classification_code provided, no more than one member of Land_physical_template shall reference that be assigned a specific value of the
attribute of .
ext_description.example:
The Land_physical_template #1235 is assigned a
of "Variable octagon" and a
of "IEC 61182-1.land type". See figure 2.
ext_description.note:
A URI may be used for the
and .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Land_physical_template is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Land_physical_template as its . There shall be one or more
for a Land_physical_template. Fabrication and assembly tolerances define the required shapes and variances for the terminal shapes.

ext_description.p: The access_mechanisms shall be .

A Land_template_interface_terminal is a type of that has an external access functionality. A Land_template_interface_terminal redefines the associated_definition attribute inherited from to only reference a .

example.p: Figure 3 is a plan view that illustrates the geometry that represents the interface terminal for a .

ext_description.p: A Land_template_join_terminal is a type of that has an internal access functionality.

example.p: Figure 4 is a plan view that illustrates the geometry that represents the join terminal for a . In the plan view, the join terminal is on the periphery.

ext_description.p:
A Land_template_terminal is a type of . A Land_template_terminal is either a
or a . The connection_zone_category shall be supplied if the
is supplied. Each member of connection_zone_category shall correspond to exactly one member of connection_area.
ext_description.note: The binding of a member of connection_zone_category to the member of connection_area is formally defined in the mapping table in clause 5.1

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
as a category of the for the Land_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There may be zero or more connection_zone_category. The interpretation of this attribute shall be to the description of the relationship between the terminal and each individual connection zone.

specifies a role of the
for the Land_template_terminal. There may be one or more
for the Land_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the connection_area shall be supplied.

specifies a role of the
for the Land_template_terminal.
The points comprising the connection_area must reside in the shape of the electrical device being accessed.
The points comprising the connection_area shall be defined in the coordinate system of the device being accessed.

The
shall not be populated.
Each member of connection_area shall reference the associated_definition as a .

The combination of associated_definition and
shall be unique within a population of Land_template_terminals.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_surface_technology is a type of
that specifies the surface characteristics for a .
ext_description.note: A Stratum_surface_technology is populated to support description of top/bottom orientation of materials in a stackup.
A Stratum_surface_technology\. may be used for humans to distinguish the two sides, e.g. 'shiny' and 'rough'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_surface_technology.

specifies a
that is a
to be in the role of surface_specification. There shall exist no more than one
for the Stratum_surface_technology.

Either at least one
shall be assigned to the Stratum_surface_technology or a
shall be provided.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_technology is a type of
and a type of . A Stratum_technology is a means to provide material properties, parametric data associated with the technology, and material identification. A Stratum_technology maybe either a
or a .
ext_description.note: Technology is used in this part of ISO 10303 to indicate that some manufacturing process has been applied to a material but the details of the process are not represented.

In a design organization, a Stratum_technology is considered to be a set of requirements that the fabricator will meet. The level of detail will vary during the product design life cycle and across a supply chain. This part of ISO 10303 provides a minimal set of generic predefined data elements found useful in real designs. Additional design specific fabrication requirements are supported in other parts of ISO 10303.
ext_description.example: ISO 10303-1669 supports the ability to exchange design specific fabrication requirements related to line and land dimensions.
ext_description.note: This part of ISO 10303 does not standardize geometric models for Stratum_technology and therefore there is no reference direction provided in Stratum_technology for orientation of raw material in a stackup model. The reference direction will be provided as part of current industrial practice between business entities in the supply chain.
ext_description.example: A laminate supplier indicates to a fabrication supplier that the long side of the rectangular material sheet is the reference axis for material property measurements.

ext_description.p:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the maximum
of any feature of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
of any feature of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the smallest allowable ratio of Stratum_technology thickness divided by the horizontal distance that a feature side wall deviates from vertical. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The aspect ratio is a factor in determining the expected quality of the process used to realize the feature. If the aspect ratio is large, meaning an extremely thick material in relation to its deviation from vertical at the edge, certain idealizations more accurately apply.

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology.

of which the Stratum_technology is a member. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

of any feature of the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the
for the thickness of the Stratum_technology.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_technology as its . There shall exist exactly one
for the Stratum_technology.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Stratum_technology is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Stratum_technology as its . There shall exist no more than two Stratum_surface_technologies for the Stratum_technology. If only one member of

The

If layer_position is , then Stratum_technology shall be .
If layer_position is , then Stratum_technology shall be .
The stratum_material shall be of type .
Either one or more surface_technology may be provided or a surface_specification may be provided, but surface_technology and surface_specification shall not be provided in the same model.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_technology_occurrence is a reference or instance of a
for the purpose of constructing an abstract stackup model of an interconnect based solely on the technology parameters and not on any specific set of geometric properties.
ext_description.note:
The actual stackup model will be constructed using
and .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Stratum_technology_occurrence is known.

specifies a role of the
for the Stratum_technology_occurrence.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that is the more positive in the z direction.
ext_description.example:
A
has a matte side and a shiny side where the shiny side is designated as the top side. In the creation of a stackup model the fabricator decides to flip the material. That fact is communicated by stating that the matt side
is referenced in the primary role. In this example two members of
are populated, matte and shiny.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the angle by which the
is rotated in a stackup definition.
ext_description.example: Cloth orientation of 90 degrees with respect to a reference direction is indicated and the laminate supplier has indicated that the long side of the rectangular material sheet is the reference axis.
ext_description.note: This attribute supporting the case where cloth orientation is required.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The name shall be unique within a population of Stratum_technology_occurrences.

ext_description.p:
A Stratum_technology_occurrence_link is a type of
A Stratum_technology_occurrence_link is a relationship that specifies a directed link between two members of Stratum_technology_occurrence. The graph composed of a set of links for a particular stackup model is acyclic or consists of only a single loop. The link exists only in the scope of a single member of . The link forms a z-axis dimension in the stackup model. The normal usage is for the subsequent
to be more negative in the z dimension than the precedent .
ext_description.note:
While it is improbable that final design definition would include a member of Stratum_technology_occurrence_link with the
equal to the , it is possible that test data or intermediate design data in a work flow may include only one stratum in a design definition and therefore the same member of
at each end of the link, forming a loop. Therefore this part of ISO 10303 supports that configuration. That configuration is only allowed in the case of a stackup model having exactly one link.
The Stratum_technology_occurrence_link constraints only enforce an acyclic constraint on graphs composed of Stratum_technology_occurrence_link. Other constraints are contained in the .

where that

as

only if that Stratum_technology_occurrence_link is the only Stratum_technology_occurrence_link in .

ext_description.p:
A Passage_technology is a type of
and a type of . A Passage_technology is a description that includes the material stackup parametric data related to the design of the interconnect substrate associated with the . A Passage_technology is either a , a , or a . A Passage_technology specifies material properties and parametric data associated with a specific manufacturing process for identified material, where that material and manufacturing process has been selected for a specific design. None of the
is required to be the same material as the deposition_material.
ext_description.note: There is no requirement that Passage_technology application increase the extent of the stackup that existed prior to application of the Passage_technology.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the largest allowable ratio of passage length divided by passage diameter for the Passage_technology_parameters. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The aspect ratio is a factor in determining the expected quality of the electroplating process in depositing metal in the passage. If the aspect ratio is large, meaning an extremely long passage in relation to its diameter, the deposition will be thinner in the central portion of the passage length than at each end of the passage. For this reason, a maximum_aspect_ratio is often determined as a factor in deciding upon the smallest passage diameters to be allowed in a PCB design. Thicker PCBs require larger minimum passage diameters, for the same expected plating quality.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Passage_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

is added to the passage for the . The value of TRUE indicates that the material is added. The value of FALSE indicates that the material is not added.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If deposition_material is provided, it's type shall be .
If Passage_technology is plated, it shall have deposition_material provided.
If as_finished_deposition_thickness is provided, then deposition_material shall be provided as well.
If Passage_technology is plated, then it's deposition_material shall be electrically, magneticly, optically or thermally conductive.
A Stratum_technology_swap_relationship is a relationship that relates two Stratum_technologies.

for the Stratum_technology_swap_relationship.

for the Stratum_technology_swap_relationship.

There can be no more than one Stratum_technology_swap_relationship that references a
as primary.

There can be no more than one Stratum_technology_swap_relationship that references a
as secondary.

ext_description.p:
If the primary_stratum_technology and secondary_stratum_technology are
and if the layer purpose is predefined then their
shall be the same.
ext_description.note: The purpose of this where rule is to ensure that the user does not mix different types of documentation layer technologies in a swap relationship. It is inappropriate to swap solder mask to silkscreen.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The type of primary_stratum_technology and secondary_stratum_technology shall be the same.

The primary_stratum_technology
shall be primary.

The secondary_stratum_technology
shall be secondary.
The primary_stratum_technology shall not be the secondary_stratum_technology.

ext_description.p: The graph of instances of the Application Object Stratum_technology_swap_relationship shall not contain a cycle.

An Unsupported_passage_template is a type of
and a type of . An Unsupported_passage_template may be a , a
or a .
ext_description.note:
The Unsupported_passage_template associates shape information with the
parametric property information. "Unsupported" carries the meaning that the passage is not mechanically or electrically supported by deposited sidewalls.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Unsupported_passage_template.

ext_description.p:
A Via_template is a type of
and a type of .
ext_description.note: A Via_template provides a template for a plated passage that supports the realization of connectivity. The access_mechanisms attribute relates the Via_template to two or more terminals, thereby capturing complete connectivity information.

A Via_template_terminal is a type of . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal in a . A Via_template_terminal is a terminal that is congruent with the exterior surface of the cylinder of the , including material covered by joined members of . The fabrication join capability is optionally constrained by a set of .

The less function returns a Boolean value to indicate if one input length is less than a second input length. Minor erroneous results due to Round off error are not considered in the design of the function, and consequently the function shall not be applied if the difference between the inputs is extremely small.
